body: @mwitkow you did the work in #444 - would the same approach work here?  If so fancy adapting it?

I'm not sure whether you can use an IAM Service Account for Google Drive Oauth scope `https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive`.

If it does, it should be as simple as replacing:
https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/master/drive/drive.go#L95
with something to
https://github.com/ncw/rclone/pull/444/files#diff-2016219251e33b0ab7f9e1f99585a44cR207

Unfortunately, I'm pretty short on time at the moment and don't have the time to experiment. Happy to help in comments though :)
Note that several people may share files with the SA and in that case files will come from different Drives, different folders. Work with filtering and path handling may differ.

issue.title: Add service account support to drive backend

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body: This addresses #839 following the suggestions from @mwitkow in that thread.

body:
This has been implemented now - please find it in this beta

https://beta.rclone.org/v1.38-198-g56cfb810/
@dav1303 @linckez take a look in [the docs](https://rclone.org/drive/#service-account-support) and try with [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org).

@ncw
Your link to the docs is a golang snippet. I'm looking for the documentation on how to use this new feature, such as the documentation on the rclone site. Thanks!
@mattkaye here are [the service account docs](https://rclone.org/drive/#service-account-support).  If you are thinking about using a service account then you may want to check out #1491 also
